DOC.brief_title: Comparison Between Ten Days Sequential Treatment Traditional Three Combined Treatment Helicobacter Pylori
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Antimicrobial resistance decrease eradication rate Helicobacter pylori infection worldwide . Objective : To determine whether sequential treatment eradicate H. pylorus infection well standard triple-drug therapy adult dyspepsia peptic ulcer Taiwanese people . Design : Randomized , single-blind , prospective control trial . Setting : A large tertiary referral hospital eastern Taiwan . Patients : 450 patient dyspepsia peptic ulcer infect H. pylorus . Measurements : 13C-urea breath test , upper endoscopy , histologic evaluation , rapid urease test , bacterial culture , assessment antibiotic resistance CYP2C19 genotype host . Intervention : 450 patient H. pylori infection randomly assign receive one follow therapeutic scheme : group A ( 5RA5RCT ) : rabeprazole ( 20 mg bid ) plus amoxicillin ( 1 g bid ) 5 day , follow rabeprazole ( 20 mg bid ) plus clarithromycin ( 500 mg bid ) tetracycline ( 1g bid ) 5 day ; group B ( 5RA5RCM ) : rabeprazole ( 20 mg bid ) plus amoxicillin ( 1 g bid ) 5 day , follow rabeprazole ( 20 mg bid ) plus clarithromycin ( 500 mg bid ) metronidazole ( 500mg bid ) 5 day ; group C control : rabeprazole ( 20 mg bid ) plus amoxicillin ( 1 g bid ) clarithromycin ( 500 mg bid . ) 10 day .
